labels.analysis: The Finance MCP Server is designed to provide real-time financial data, including stock and cryptocurrency prices and related news. Its core functionality revolves around delivering up-to-date market intelligence, which can be integrated into applications or decision-making processes. The available tools ("get_price" and "get_news") suggest that the server is focused on fetching and presenting financial market information efficiently.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Financial Services" is chosen because the server specializes in providing financial data (prices and news) for stocks and cryptocurrencies, which aligns with the category of tools that offer banking, payments, and financial data services. The "Cryptocurrency & Blockchain" label is added as a secondary label because of its specific focus on crypto-related tools. "Web Search & Research" is included as another secondary label due to the server's role in gathering and delivering financial news, which can aid in research. No custom label is necessary as the predefined categories cover the server's functionality well.

server_info_crawled.author: @Otman404/finance-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Get accurate and up-to-date prices and news about stock and cryptocurrency tickers. Leverage real-time financial data to enhance your applications and decision-making processes. Integrate seamlessly with your LLMs for enriched financial insights.

tools.name: get_price
tools.description: Get the price of a stock/crypto ticker.

tools.name: get_news
tools.description: Get the news of a stock/crypto ticker.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Otman404/finance-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
